intro: Amaracarpus nummatus, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, legume-like pods that contain its seeds. Amaracarpus nummatus is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
